intro: Pseudosmodingium anomalum, commonly known as the strange false moss, is a rare and delicate liverwort species. It belongs to the family Porellaceae and is characterized by its intricate, moss-like appearance. This plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often found in forest floors or rocky crevices. Its structure consists of leafy shoots with small, scale-like leaves arranged in a tight rosette. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
